Software Development Engineer (SDE)
Electrical and Electronics Engineering
Btech – CSE, ECE, EEE , Mtech – CSE, ECE, EEE, MCA
CGPA >= 6.5 and No Active Backlog
1. Online Test
2. Technical Interview -1
3. Technical Interview  -2
4. Technical + HR interview
Description of Online test:
This round was of 2.5 hrs and comprised of 5 sections:
A.	Debugging Round (20 Minutes) :
There were 7 problems. And in each problem statement, input /output (expected) and code was given and we needed to debug the given code to  pass all the test cases.
B.	Coding Round (70 Minutes):
There were 2 problems of medium level .
One problem was to count all substring having at most K distinct characters and another was to find the maximum of all subarrays of size k .
C.	Behavioral Round (20 Minutes):
In this round many situational problems (MCQs) were given to test your behavior, leadership principle and moral values.
D.	Aptitude Round (35 Minutes ) :
There were 24 Aptitude problems.
Description of Technical Interview:
Technical Interview Round 1:
Interviewer started off by giving a small introduction of himself and he asked me to introduce myself. In this round the interviewer asked me 2 coding problems based on data structures and algorithms.
First problem was that – we have a binary tree and we need to print the binary tree in vertical order (Vertical Order Traversal). I told him the optimized approach and also discussed space and time complexities , then he asked me to write code in ‘amazon code live’.
After this he asked me another problem – we are given N petrol pumps on a circle and at each petrol pump, distance from that petrol pump to the next petrol pump and amount of petrol at that petrol pump is given . We need to tell the first circular tour that visits all petrol pumps without losing petrol in between two petrol pumps. I explained both brute force and optimized O(N) approach and then he asked me to code optimized approach again in ‘amazon code live’.
Technical Interview Round 2:
Interview started with my introduction. And in this round also the interviewer asked me 2 coding problems. Both problems were of Dynamic Programming (DP).
First question was that – we have a N-ary tree and and we need to print  kth ancestor of all nodes of binary tree .I started discussion with brute force and for further optimization I discussed Binary Lifting Technique (DP approach) to find kth ancestor  and time & space complexities  . After that I  coded it.
Second problem was that – we are given K dice and we need to tell no. of ways to get N (sum of all dice output). I discussed DP approach (optimized ) and then he asked me to code for both DP methods – Top-down and Bottom-up .
Description of HR Round:
Technical + HR Round (Final Round)
Firstly Interviewer gave his introduction and asked me to introduce myself. Then Interviewer asked me to explain one of my projects . I explained my project in which Reactjs and Reduxjs were used .
So he asked some questions on Reactjs and Reduxjs .
Then he gave me one situational problem and asked  how I’ll react to  this situation .
After that  he gave me a problem that we are building a web application in which a delivery boy gets the destination address whenever someone books in order. And I need to give a solution for deciding  the shortest path from the starting point of the delivery boy to his destination.  Actually it was a Graph question and I discussed Dijkstra’s algorithm to solve this problem . I also discussed space and time complexity. Then he asked me to code.
At last he asked me to ask some questions if I have any.
Keep practicing DSA problems from InterviewBit, Leetcode or GFG. Also give equal importance to  CS subjects(OS,DBMS) and OOPs. Keep your resume ready with 2-3 good projects in Web development or Android development or Machine Learning. And make sure that you should be perfect in everything you have written in your resume .
When a question is asked, be confident, start with the Brute Force approach  and keep communicating with the interviewer and let him/her know about your approach.
Competitive Programming: Codechef, Codeforces, Hackerearth
DSA: Leetcode, InterviewBit, GFG

Description of Online test:
This round was of 2.5 hrs and comprised of 5 sections:
A.	Debugging Round (20 Minutes) :
There were 7 problems. And in each problem statement, input /output (expected) and code was given and we needed to debug the given code to  pass all the test cases.
B.	Coding Round (70 Minutes) :
There were 2 problems of medium level
C.	Behavioral Round (20 Minutes) :
In this round many situational problems (MCQs) were given to test your behavior, leadership principle and moral values.
D.	Aptitude Round (35 Minutes ) :

Description of Technical Interview:
The interviewer started off by giving a small introduction of herself and then asked me to introduce myself. Then the interviewer asked me 2 coding questions based on data structures and algorithms.
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/burn-the-binary-tree-starting-from-the-target-node/
https://leetcode.com/problems/group-anagrams/

Description of HR Round:
From a 3rd year student the companies expect to have some decent problem solving skills
so be good with DSA problems. Also be good in the CS subjects like OOPS, DBMS. having 1 or 2 projects in your resume is better. Make sure you are perfect with your resume as the interviewer may ask anything from your resume. research about the company before the interview as it will come in handy. And coming to the technical interview just be confident. listen to the questions carefully and answer the questions you know for sure. be as transparent as you can be towards your interviewer so that your interview can be as smooth as possible
DSA: Leetcode, GFG, interviewbit
competitive programming: codeforces, codechef

Electrical and Electronics Engineering
We were allowed to choose from Hyderabad, Pune, Noida, Chennai
B.tech(circuit branches), Mtech(circuit branches)
CGPA Cutoff - 6.5 with no active backlog
There were two rounds,
Round 1 : Online Test
Round 2 : Interview
Description of Online test:
Test duration was 150 mins and comprised of 5 sections:
A.	Debugging Round (20 Minutes) :
There were 7 problems. And in each problem statement, input /output (expected) and code was given and we needed to debug the given code to  pass all the test cases.The questions were pretty much easy, one can complete the round within 10 mins easily.
B.	Coding Round (70 Minutes) :
There were 2 problems of medium level, the problems were standard with a slight modification, nothing out of the bound was asked.
C.	Behavioral Round (20 Minutes) :
In this round many situational problems (MCQs) were given to test your behavior, leadership principle and moral values. For getting this round clear, one should be aware of amazon leadership principles.
D.	Aptitude Round (35 Minutes ) :
There were 24 Aptitude problems. Medium level aptitude questions were asked.
E.	Feedback. Giving feedback was important. Although it doesn't had time limit, but your test was not considered as complete without filling the feedback. Feedback was asked about their platform.
Description of Technical Interview:
The round was held on amazon chime and a live codepair link was given to write code. The interview started with a small introduction by the interviewer, and he just asked my name and branch, and was not at all interested in this. He directly moved on to the coding part. Two questions were asked, one was based on optimisation and second was modification of buying and selling of stock with certain constraints. The interviewer was very much focused on my approaches. Every time I say something, he always tells me to code this and show him how it will work so be confident about whatever you speak. The round lasted for 1 hr 15 mins, nothing else was asked except dsa questions.
Description of HR Round:
For the people in the circuit branch, be focused on the dsa subject that you have. Start preparing last to last by 2-2, that's high time. Give contests regularly on leetcode and codeforces(optional). Also parallely keep preparing other required subject  i.e. OOPS and DBMS. Try to make small small projects which will be very much useful on your resume. Build your resume one month before starting the intern drive. In summer vacations, Solve interviewbit completely as revision. Be consistent with problem solving.
At the time of intern drive, there will be situations when you'll not be shortlisted for certain companies and your friend will get selected, keep yourself motivated at that time. This is very much important. Don't rush for a particular company, whenever there is a test, always try to give your best. Your hardwork will surely give you results. If you feel low anytime, talk to your friends, your parents, your seniors. They will cheer you up.Reach out your seniors for any kind of help at any point of time. All the best!
Coding platforms- Leetcode(must do for dsa), GFG, Interviewbit(must solve complete interviewbit one month before the drive), codeforces(for CP)
Youtube channels- Code n code(for graphs), Aditya Verma(many topics are there, best for DP), code with harry, love babbar(DSA Cheatsheet), Abdul Bari(for algorithms), Sanchit Jain(DBMS), Tushar Roy
websites- javatpoint(reading for oops) w3schools, gfg, In leetcode always go through discussions after solving a problem

Round 2-Technical interview

Description of Online test:
Online test consists of 90 questions for 90 minutes divided into 2 parts
1.Aptitude Test- Aptitude, Logical and verbal reasoning,Data interpretation
2.Technical Test- Problems and conceptual questions from Electrical Machines,Control Systems,Power Systems and its Protection,Circuit Theory, Electrical Instruments
Shortlisted students were sent a Psychometric test link which consists of behavior and work related questions.
Description of Technical Interview:
Technical interview was for 20 min and questions are like:
1.Introduction of the candidate
2.What is your favorite subject?
3.Different concepts related to electrical machines and their working
4.Basic questions like
(ii) What are components of the electrical network etc..
5.Questions and explanation of project and courses mentioned in resume
Description of HR Round:
HR interview lasted for 20min and the interview went like:
1.Why do you want to intern at Bajaj?
2.Which role would you like manufacturing or R&D?
3.Short term and long term goals
4.How would you justify that you are a team worker?
For electrical subjects lecture notes will suffice

Electrical and Electronics Engineering
6 CGPA cutoff for CSE, ECE, EEE, Mech, Chemical, MME, M.Sc.
8 CGPA cutoff for Civil and Biotech
Round 1 - online test
Round 2 - technical interview
Round 3 - technical and HR interview
Description of Online test:
In total, there are four coding questions given. The entire test is proctored. First question is on hashmap. It is an easy level question and if you have a basic idea on hashmaps it can be solved in 5-10 minutes and second question is that you have to print the shortest palindrome of two given strings. It is a standard dp model question. If you are able to do DP upto moderate level, you can do it very easily. Third question is also based on DP(dynamic programming). The question has twists and it took some time for me to identify that it is a DP problem. Finally, I space optimised and solved it completely. It is a medium to hard level question. Finally, the fourth question is on 2d matrix. It is a medium to hard level question. I solved it for a long time and submitted it but I was confused whether it got submitted or not as I lost my internet connection at the last moment. Till now it's suspicious for me whether it got submitted or not.
Description of Technical Interview:
In the first technical round interviewer was cool and very friendly.He had given me a question in a hackerrank based on priority queue .It is easy level question.And later he asked how I can implement priority queue using classes .He asked me to prototype and explain the implementation and all stuff.I explained it briefly until the interviewer gets satisfied.
In the second technical interview also interviewer was very friendly.He has given me a question and asked me to tell approach for it.It is based on stacks.It is medium level type question.And later he asked me about my DBMS project and went deeply into it.Also he asked my few oops concepts .Finally ,after asking few hr questions interview was finished.
Description of HR Round:
There is no separate round for HR
It is combined with the second technical round only.They asked me:
Why do you want to join Bny Mellon,
What's your favourite subject in engineering,
How will you deal with the stressful situations,and a few more questions were asked.
Don't give routine answers .Try to give answers that can impress him.
Do CP well. It's enough to qualify for the OTs.
Be thorough with OOPs and DBMS also about the project if you have done any..
While following the playlist don't just blindly watch the whole video .First listen to the question and open that question in leetcode/gfg and give it a try. Spend at least 20-30 minutes to solve that question. If you can't figure out the solution, then resume and in the middle somewhere you will definitely get the idea. And then try once again, and if you don't get it, then only watch the complete video.
Also another important thing ,after solving a question in leetcode,go to the discussion section and watch the others solution so that you can make out different approaches. Most of the learning takes place here only.
Also complete the interviewbit in the last 3 months. Try to complete at least 60% of the problems in it.
Aditya Verma,takeuforward YouTube channels for coding.There will be playlists for important concepts in those YouTube channels.
Gfg,leetcode , interviewbit for practicing coding questions.
Knowledge gate YouTube channel for dbms
Oops you can study from anywhere.I personally followed code with Harry YouTube channel and practiced questions in gfg.
Additional info for our viewers:
1.All your coding skills will be tested in your ot only.Most of the time the coding questions asked in your interview will be easier than the questions those were asked in the ots .
2.Don't get tensed in the interviews.Generally most of the interviewers are really very friendly.
3.Don't think that non-cse branch students cannot get into software easily.ofc it's not easy than cse ,but if you have enough preparation it is easy.
4.Be thorough with oops and dbms.
Language doesn't matter for oops.If you are comfortable with c++,then go with it.
5. If you have good rating  in any of the cp websites it gives some positive impression .But it is not the case that if you don't have good rating you can't get selected.Even though  you don't have any rating it doesn't matter if you have good coding skills.
6.Last and final thing ,there can be cases like even if you solve all the questions in ot you may not get selected and others who solves partially may get selected.This might happens and happened also.Dont get demotivated in those cases ,just smile and keep going . Always remember one thing..hardwork always pays off!!

Round 1 - Resume Shortlisting

Description of Online test:
1. There was one SQL question
2. One Programming (difficulty level easy)
3. 16 MCQ's on programming basics , oops (mostly java), pseudocode , and logical questions
Description of Technical Interview:
Description of HR Round:
This round was mostly behavioral and situation based questions.
Consisted of typical STAR Method based questions like:
1. What projects you did and what challenges did you face?
2. How did you overcome those and solved these problems?
3. Give an example when you proved yourself beyond the expectations of the team/mentor, and did work ,provided solutions more than you were supposed to do.
Few more questions like these and it went on for around 40-45 minutes.
1. Focus mainly on the DSA part.
2. If you are at beginner level, start with hackerrank and solve questions. Then when you think you have done much of hackerrank , move to leetcode.
3. Start by solving leetcode questions based on the difficulty and go out of your comfort zone .
4. Make it a habit to visit discussion sections of leetcode for each question  irrespective of whether you could solve it or not and learn by seeing how others did it.
5. Try to make a list of questions you find important(which has more than one concept) and solve these before any interview or OT.
6. Start off with oops and DBMS once you think you are comfortable with the DSA part. Keep studying these in parallel with DSA.
7. Make a good project and try to revisit your project everyday and get to know what and why you did so in the project.
1. Leetcode (Solve questions and also give Biweekly and weekly contests)
2. InterviewBit
3. GFG ( For Clearing your doubts and also reading previous experiences)
4. CodeChef and Codeforces (if you are interested in CP)
5. Aditya Verma (Youtube for DP)
6. My Code School (Youtube for basic DSA)
Additional info for our viewers:
1. Just start preparing as soon as possible. Contact your seniors and ask them what to do and how to do it.
2. Prepare an organized schedule and follow that.
3. In the beginning, don't go after all the resources you have. Just start with any to avoid confusion and waste time. Later on you can visit other resources when you feel like it[.
4. Be consistent even if you are not able to solve questions. Discuss with friends (the best way to learn and keep yourself motivated).

Description of Online test:
The online test consisted of 2 Coding questions and 25 MCQ questions
Question 1- Minimum steps to reach a target by a Knight.  (MEDIUM)
https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/minimum-steps-reach-target-
Question 2 – convert the string into dd- mm- yyyy Format.  (EASY)
https://leetcode.com/problems/reformat-date/
25 MCQs questions based on various topics such as Operating Systems, DBMS, Computer Networks, OOPS, C Programming, Algorithms.
Description of Technical Interview:
Technical interview round 1
It was taken on hackerrank code pair platform and we were asked to pass all test cases.
Question 1- Merge two sorted array (EASY)
I solved first using brute force approach then I optimized the code using a two         pointer approach. Then the interviewer asked me to explain the space and time complexity of code.
Question 2- Count total no of ways to score a target run by using 1,4,6 only.(MEDIUM)
I solved it using Dynamic programming.
Question 3- Diamond problem in inheritance and how to resolve that issue.
Then he asked me about interfaces and abstract classes.
Question 4 – why do we need normalisation in DBMS  and its TYPES.
Description of HR Round:
(Tech + HR) interview round 2
First the interviewer asked for a brief explanation of my project and he asked some questions related to it.
Question 1-How indexing is implemented in DBMS.
Question 2 –  There are n villages and a postman. Find a Smallest possible distance covered by postman to delivers a letter t
I told him the approach using the Floyd- warshall algorithm, but he wanted me to optimise the approach. He had given some hints then I told him by using a minimum spanning tree. I implemented the code and dry run the test cases and he was satisfied with that approach.
Question 3 – He gave some COVID related graphical data and asked some mathematical and analytical questions on that.
Then he asked me about my favourite data structure. I told him Trie data structure .
Then he asked me how do you use this data structure in the present (COVID) scenario.
Then next he asked me some Behavioural & situational questions.
Study fundamentals of OOPS,DBMS and OS (CN - if you have time) .
If you know the solutions of a problem don’t directly run into an optimised solution . First share brute force approach then optimised one. Try to cover all corner edge cases for a problem.
Do participate in short contests on codechef , leetcode .
Go through InterviewBit during the summer holidays.
Have faith in your abilities, prepare hard as u can and hope for the best.
(DP-Aditya Verma videos,SDE sheet By STRIVER)

Computer Fundamentals  - GFG articles

B.Tech Chemical and Mechanical branches
Round 1- Resume Shortlisting
Round 2- OT
Round 3 & 4- Technical interview and HR interview
Description of Online test:
Technical- basic knowledge from Engineering course, elementary school level Science concepts (Chemistry, Physics), miscellaneous engineering questions
Description of Technical Interview:
Questions were from every nook and corner of our Chemical Engineering course.
Important subjects are: Mass Transfer, Heat Transfer, Thermodynamics, Fluid Mechanics, Chemical Reaction Engineering.
Definitions, formulae, differences, applications and reasoning based questions related to our core concepts.
Explanation of concepts with examples was required.
Interview duration : 20-40 minutes
Description of HR Round:
Behavioral and Situational interview questions. Focus on STAR methodology (situation, task, action and result). Teamwork and leadership qualities were tested. Confidence and the way you present yourself and your responses matters.
Every interview begins with "Tell me about yourself " and ends with "Any Questions". Be mindful and give a strong optimistic response.
Preparation for internship after 2nd year during summer break is the best time. Be thorough with the fundamental concepts of 2nd year. Utilize the summer break extensively in revising all the topics, preparing for the HR round. Try doing a project/internship , this really adds value.
Grab every prospect for preparation. Attend any resume building workshop, mock interviews or GDs for practice.
From every experience analyze the situations and yourself, you learn from the observations, imply it to yourself then you grow and get better the next time.
Resources used while preparing for our course would suffice. ( Class Notes, prescribed books of subjects, NPTEL etc.).
Brush up on your 11th and 12th grade Physics, Chemistry for OTs.
For HR Round, deep introspection of your experiences are your resources to answer as per STAR methodology.
Additional info for our viewers:
Passion, Practice, Persistence are the key to ace internships and placement drives.
Hope for the best but be ready for the worst. If you ardently work hard towards your goal, success will definitely chase you.

EEDP Engineer - Edison Engineering Development Program Engineer
Electrical and Electronics Engineering
As an Edison Engineering Development Program(EEDP) Engineer, one will be exposed to different modalities within GE Healthcare like Imaging, Digital, Maternity Care etc., for a span of two years. The role specification depends on the modality and the necessity of the work. Both hardware and software choices will be available at each modality.
Round 1 - Online Test
Round 2 - Pymetrics gamified assessment
Round 3 - Technical
Round 4 - HR
Description of Online test:
Online test had 3 sub sections. Aptitude section has 50MCQs to be solved in 50 minutes .The second section had technical questions 30 questions, 30 min. For software, the topics include DSA, DBMS, OS, and CN.  And two coding questions, for which 45 minutes were allotted. The coding questions were of medium level problems one was based on dynamic programming and other was linked list problem.
On the same day, pymetrics test link was sent to the selected candidates. It is a game-based assessment consisting of 12 games. It tests the numerical and logical reasoning of the candidate to assess one's behaviour. Elimination for further rounds was done through this test too.
Description of Technical Interview:
It was like a rapid fire round, in my case. Initially, we were informed that  they would be hiring for both hardware and software roles. But no clarity was given on who would be having interviews for which role. In my case, as I am from EEE, questions were covered from software, hardware and electrical questions. The following are the questions:
3)Difference between BJT and MOSFET
5)Why do we use voltage regulator?
7)Different data structures and uses
8)Which field are you interested to work in?
And depending on the answers, further explanation was asked. But the interviewer was so cool and asked questions only based on the previous semesters’ knowledge at that point of time.
After my two month internship in the company, I had a technical interview based on my project in those two months and a few situation based questions. I had done my internship in hardware role and the project was "Battery Health Monitoring for Darwin Anesthesia Machine". This interview was taken by an external(outside GE) person. The questions were:
1) What was your project about?
2) What did you learn from your project?(detailed explanation)
3)What would you do to improve the current project?
4)How is the work culture in GE?
5)What is your biggest weakness?(it led to multiple questions)
A few situation based questions like
"If you were given a task and you do not know anything about it, how would you move forward?"
"Do you believe in team work? And would you help your teammates with their work?"
"Who is more important to you, family or company?" ( prolonged for lot of time)
Description of HR Round:
2)What do you know about GE Healthcare?
3) What did you find interesting in GE healthcare?
4)What are the projects you have finished?
5)Have you ever fought with your peers and how did you resolve it?
6)What are your strengths and weaknesses?
7)What are your areas of interest?
8)In which position would you like to see yourself five years later?
9)Would it be okay for you to relocate?
General questions about project and the other questions were:
2)What is your review on GE healthcare?
3)How was your interaction with the other employees?
4)What did you like in GE Healthcare?
5)Why do you think we should hire you among all the other candidates?
6)Do you have any other plans like M.S. or further studies?
A few logical questions like " How do you divide a paper into 3 parts without using anything?"
For bagging an internship, after B.Tech 2nd year, the summer break should be utilised well. Doing courses and projects related to your area of interest will help you improve your skills and build a good resume. Adding to that, it gives you confidence while facing the internship session pressure. For software preparation, one can improve upon themselves, by practicing and coding more problems, optimising at each step, each day.  For hardware preparation, in analog and digital electronics having basic knowledge and good notes from the earlier semesters would be sufficient. Practice and revision, both, should be in hand for any preparation.
For software preparation, leetcode provides a lot of problems ranging from easy to medium to hard.

And having fear is completely normal, but one needs to maintain fear as well as confidence in equal ratio, to get one's maximum output. And there is no late point to start preparation. Learning is a continuous process. Do not lose the hope in you due to the external pressure. Keep your calm and do your best.

The second question which was that " Given a m*n chessboard with a knight placed at source_x, source_y . Find whether the knight can reach the destination coordinates and also the minimum steps to do so".
The last question was " Given a binary array where each element denoted a bulb and if the bulb was on,  the value of element would be 1 otherwise 0. Description of Online test:
Section 1- Two easy-medium coding questions
Q1- Given a number, we have to check whether at some step, the sum of the factorial of digits of the number can be the same as the given number (Hint: I used hash-map).
Q2- Given a string of a sentence containing spaces. We have to return the absolute difference between the sum of the length of words in odd position and even position.
Section 2- (8-10) Mathematics MCQs (Hard)
Section 3- One medium-hard coding question
Q3- Given a vector of distinct strings, we have to find the maximum number of strings which we can take such that we can arrange them consecutively only with following rules-
Two strings are a and b, then max(len(a),len(b))=N+1 ,where N is the longest common suffix of a and b.
Example- {rgy, bgy, ash, y, gy}
Explanation- rgy->bgy->gy->y is one of the possible outcome
Section 4- Two general essay questions and word limit was 200 words for each question
Q1- If you are working in a group project and your teammate left that in the middle of it due to some reason, then what will you do in that situation?
Q2- Describe a time when you got an unexpected and unbelievable outcome of a project.
Section 5- OS, DSA, OOP related MCQs
Description of Technical Interview:
Round 1-
The interviewer was very friendly. First, he looked into my resume and asked for a small introduction of my projects, then he asked me to write some tables and their attributes from my DBMS project in the hackerrank code editor.
Then he modified one of the tables and gave a question and told me to write a SQL query. The query was using aggregate function and group by clause. Then he asked me if I knew trees, to which I said yes. Then I was asked to write a pre-order traversal code (using recursion was fine) along with its time and space complexity. Then he asked which tree is best for searching and some indexing in the database question(I answered B tree).
Round 1 was over and he seemed satisfied with all my answers.
Round 2-
He looked into my resume and asked about my DBMS project. Then he moved on to the coding part-
Q1- Given a string, we have to find the first non- repeating character in the string.
Ex- string is "sggssjda" then output will be 'j'
I first told my approach to solve it and then he asked me to write the code and then execute it.
I solved it using hash-map and also given time complexity.
Q2- To find the kth largest element from a given array. For this he said just to write pseudo code. I gave two approaches i.e. using priority queue and using sorting (quick sort) along with their time complexities. But he was asking about a more optimized method which I couldn't but then he said that's okay.
Moving forward, he asked questions from oops part, like encapsulation with real life examples, inheritance with examples. After this, we discussed a lot about method overriding, method overloading, runtime and compile time polymorphism etc.
Then he asked me to define normalisation with any example by writing table names with its attributes in the code editor. Then he asked about the normal form of the given example to which I explained the criteria of all the normal forms and then identified it.
Round 2 was over then and I was asked to wait for round 3
Description of HR Round:
Round 3-
This was the HR round and it lasted only for 10-15mins. He looked into my resume and asked about my projects. Then he asked many questions by giving situations related to working on some group project.
They mainly focused on my dbms skills and were looking for a required knowledge about oops and problem solving part. Also, they are looking for your approach to solve any problem.
Contests in codeforces, codechef and leetcode
Interview bit (would recommend for last 2-3months DSA preparation)

Electrical and Electronics Engineering
This is the first time ITC has taken a Data Science intern. So not very sure of the role.
ITC has a KITES form wherein they ask thorough questions such as future plans, most satisfying moment along with academic criteria. Candidates were shortlisted based on this form response.
Description of Online test:
There was no online test
Description of Technical Interview:
There were two technical interviews. Both based on my CV. I had a Data Science oriented CV because of which the questions in the first round were on Data Science and my Project. The questions were:
1) Difference between AI and Data Science
2) Algorithm of Support Vector Machines
And a couple of Project based questions.
The second round was with regional heads of ITC. This round majorly consisted of core questions apart from explaining my project in detail. The questions were:
1) Can PNP and NPN transistors be reversibly used?
3) Question about Synchronous Induction Motor.
4) What is the significance of real and imaginary power?
Description of HR Round:
HR round was a group discussion round wherein a random scenario was explained and we had to reflect on it. Communication skills, Thinking and Approach, confidence were tested.
Resumé must be to the point as it played an important role in questions being posed. We must be confident enough to speak elaborately about any point mentioned in the resumé. Preparation must be done accordingly.
Apart from Academics, I didn't specially prepare for the interview.
Additional info for our viewers:
I did some ground research about future plans of ITC, it's current projects and requirements and sectors in which the company is investing. This gave me an edge in the interview because I could confidently tell that this is what I bring to the table to match your requirements. I suggest any aspiring candidate to do the same. Know about your company, it's objectives, goals and requirements and answer accordingly.

Electrical and Electronics Engineering
Every Intern will be assigned a real life industry project on certain issues the company is facing.
Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Chemical Engineering
No bar on CGPA. The selections are based on Resume and Kites form which needs to be filled with the details of 10th, 12th, B-tech Semester wise GPA and other things including Projects and extracurricular activities.
Round 1 - Online Application(Resume and Kites Form)
Round 2 - Group Discussion
Round 3 - Technical Round
Round 4 - HR Round
Description of Online test:
There was no online test
Description of Technical Interview:
Most of the Technical Questions are from core subjects like Electrical Machines and Power Systems although some questions are asked from Digital Electronics. Questions are mostly related to basic conceptual understanding of the subject. Some of the Questions are
1. How does a single Phase induction motor start?
2. Explain Hysteresis curve and how do you select a material for Machine Design?
3. Different methods for improving efficiency of Power Transmission?
4. Design a model for FSM? (A specific case is given)
Some questions are asked to know about your projects or work experience with any team or extra-curricular activities (related to management)
Description of HR Round:
Questions include technical and Managerial some of them are:
1. Can we replace a npn transistor with a pnp transistor in a circuit?
2. Why is the npn transistor most widely used?
3. Question based on operation of transformers in parallel
1. management related experience
2. Questions based on your project
Understand the given description of the problem. It is not necessary to start first but make sure about two things
1. You should not repeat the same things others have already mentioned.
2. It will be better if you can add some different perspectives from your side.
For Technical Questions:
You must be good at the basics of core subjects like Electrical Machines, Power Systems, Analog and Digital Electronics. Prepare good notes for these subjects(easy to revise). Although there is no OT, it is good to practise numericals so that you can answer the questions with some quantitative approximations.
For other questions:
It will be better if you have any experience in working with a team or any extra-curricular activities or projects.

As I did a project in databases he asked "What is a database?" and "Where is the database stored?". Then he asked to show what programs i did recently. Next question is "what is IC with number 7486 IC?" Then he asked what is NAND gate and its outputs, function and uses.
Description of HR Round:
He was very approachable and comfortable while asking questions. Firstly he asked about 2 basic hardware questions then he asked about software questions. He asked me to type the code for either of the programs ``stack using queues" or "queue using stacks" and also asked me to write a program to a string question which he dictated. He asked me to give the approach to solve the program and then asked me to write code.
Decide on what you want to do whether software job or hardware. Practice coding more. Data structures and dynamic programming are important even if it is a hardware profile. Reflect on your mistakes and improve. Start from day 1 of 1st year. Every small step will add up to the final output whether it is intern or placement. Stay focused and motivated. Do a project during 2nd year or before 3rd year. And be confident about the topics in the project. Prior knowledge on your project is very important.
Geeks for Geeks for practise, Codechef contests, Leetcode contests

Computer Science and Engineering
1 OT ,2 technical interview and 1 HR round
Description of Online test:
In OT there will be 4 sections Verbal ability , Aptitude , computer science basics, coding section .
In every section there will be 3-4 sub sections which will have 7-8 qsns and time limit given.
Every section will have individual time limit like for aptitude it was 47 mins for 36 qsns for coding it was 35 mins for 30 qsns
And there was no negative marking so you can mark every qsn without any fear
In verbal ability section there were qsns related to grammars like you have to correct some sentences , or choose a word which has similar meaning to given word, 4-5 qsns based on passage, rearrange words like this
In coding section there were qsns based on output predicting and depicting errors in functions and most importantly there were many qsns on AVL tree . So before sitting in ORACLE make sure to read about AVL tree
In computer science basics section There were qsns related to OS, DBMS,OOPs except OS all qsns were easy only and u can answer them if u have ur basics strong .
In Aptitude section there were common aptitude qsns like work and time , and pncs qsns u can find them on GFG , if u are a jee student then u can easily do those qsns , there was 1 section under aptitude know as flow chart based qsns in that part u will be given some instructions or algorithm to solve a qsn and on the basis of that a flow chart of that algo would be given to you and there will be some blanks in that flow chart that u will have to fill , so this is also a medium level qsn only
Try to do best in ur OT  , yeah time wont be sufficient enough for some qsns in aptitude like i randomly ticked some qsns because time wasn't there , but dont worry u will not be alone who will be doing this .
Description of Technical Interview:
ROUND 1
When the interviewer came , he asked me to intoduce myself so i did for 2-3 mins then he asked me how was ur  2nd year since ours was online thats why he asked for . Then he asked me a qsn about DOM that i didnt know because i didnt about XML so i told him that i dont know about this , if u dont know anything about a topic just tell them that u dont know .
After that he asked me about DOM model , i think i dont quite remember the name but it was like this that u have to create a Generic BOM model that we can use for any product
BOM model: lets understand it with an example lets say u have a product called PC (personal computer) so it can have many components like CPU, keyboard,mouse,printer etc and then again CPU can contain many components like SMPS,motherboard,hard disk , then again motherboard can contain many things like register , RAM, etc so as u can see their is an Heirarchy type of thing  . But in the start i didnt understand because the interviewer was also that explaining like i did here so i told them that i can make abstract classes of pc then i can implement them in the products then again use abstract classes and i will achieve that thing but it was not the right answer i thought so i then asked him that whether i have to give him a data structure or any oops soln so he asked me to give a data structure soln so i told them that since its heierarchial we can use K-ARY Tree for this , then he told me to draw it on white board the he asked me to code the structure  of the tree , and i easily coded it since i knew about K-ARY tree earlier only in KR sir's class. Then he asked me Whether i can implement this thing without using Data structure i was confused at this time so i asked him sir how we can implement this heirarchial thing without trees so he told me to do it in DBMS . So i told him that i would create 2 table , one for root id and second for Child table having root id as foreign key there and there will be one to many relationship from root to child , we can find the childs using root id then we can again use those child ids as root ids and recursively find all the childs of that node . He was pretty satisfied with this solution.
Then he asked me to explain about my project , i was having a project on TODO list so i explained them how i made this and what problems i faced during the implementation of my project .
Then he asked me how would i implement a Score board that will display runs and will auto maticlly refresh so i told them i can use Socket.io library(package) and achieve this , then he asked me whether i can do any alternative i said no sir i dont know
This concluded my 1st interview i was asked to wait in post interview round since i was selected for further round .
Link to the pic of the BOM model :
https://drive.google.com/file/d/1DbjXvDZ57SYqgNedfG5qVIaBK3MQdOvB/view?usp=sharing
ROUND 2
I was selected directly for 3rd round , though there were many students who has to give 3 round.
Description of HR Round:
ROUND 3
It was my HR round . When the HR came he asked me how was my last interview , i said sir it was good then he asked me what qsns did he asked and what solns i gave so i explained my first round to him then upon hearing my Tree answer he asked my is there only need of searching and sorting in tree , is tree useful for any other things ? i told him we use it for maintaining hierarchical order and then again he asked my what if i didn't take unique values means what if I will take repeated data then I explained him with the concepts of database like data redundancy and data inconsistency and he was satisfied with it Then he asked me what if i didn't took sorted values , i explained him with indexing of dbms that we take sorted values for logn searching etc. Then he asked my what do u feel as a computer science undergraduate , so u have to give ur honest answer for this and i gave something like there's always learning in CS and everytime u know that u have became superior there is someone who is already superior that u and u try learning hard etc... then he asked me how my friends affected my learning and life so i told them u can frame ur own answer on this . Then he asked my why u want to join oracle u can google search about these things and then he told me we are done for today .
You can easily crack the OT of oracle but to crack interviews u should have good knowledge of object oriented programming, DBMS, DSA.
for DSA solve questions from leetcode around 400-500 will be fine.
leetcode have 3 category of questions easy , medium and hard try to solve more medium level questions rather than easy ones.
Apart from leetcode practice on codeforces and score a good rating there by participating the contests atleast 1200-1300 rating is good enough.
leetcode, codeforces, codechef, hackerrank

Round 1- OT
Round 2- Technical Interview
Round 3- HR
Description of Online test:
The OT was held on 13th August 2021 on Hirepro platform. There were 3 sections in the OT. Aptitude, C-Programming, Profile Dependent (Software, Hardware). Each of these 3 sections had 20 questions and 30 minutes was given for each section. So, 90 mins in total. Each Question carried +1 for correct and -0.25 negative marking for wrong answers.
There were questions on-
A Paragraph on Seating Arrangement based on which 5 questions were asked.
One Data Interpretation question based on which 5 questions were asked.
Overall, this section is easy, just keep a watch on TIME!
​Basic C questions on-
Few Questions from Data Structures like
1 Question from Operating System
This section had questions on-
Implementation of function using a minimum number of NAND/ NOR gates.
Few questions on CMOS
1 Question on microcontrollers, ADC, OpAmps.
Description of Technical Interview:
After the OT, there was a Technical Interview the next day. Interviews were held on Microsoft Teams. The interviewer was very friendly. He started with my Hobbies first.
Then moved to my Formal Introduction. Tip: Remember the Headers on your resume and briefly explain about each section. Introduction shouldn't take more than 2 mins. If the interviewer is interested, he'll ask more specifically about that part.
First, he asked me about the NAND gate then asked me to design it from a Transistor (BJT or MOS). He asked about ALU, it's working and asked me to make one.
He asked me to Write a code for an array of function pointers that point to 10 different functions. Some other basic C-related questions were asked.
He was very interested in my projects. He asked me to explain in detail about our e-yantra project. We spent almost 8 mins here. I hope the importance of projects is very clear at this point.
He then asked about my Positions of Responsibility. I was in both ECEA and EA & HAM Club, I explained in brief what we do here and my role there.
It was a short interview for 30 Mins.
Description of HR Round:
2 hours after the Technical Interview, there was a call from HR.
The HR round lasted approximately for 5 mins. It was a casual telephonic call.
1. She asked me to introduce myself and tell about my family
2. My feedback on the Technical Interview Round.
3. Why do I want to join Qualcomm?
4. What are my long-term goals?
5. My Work Location preferences?
6. Do I have any questions?
For that, I asked what does the company expect from a fresher and which projects I will be working on if I get selected.
That was it. Nothing Technical Here :)
One Hour after the HR round, the Final Select List was released.
The first important thing is to know what to prepare, the syllabus, what kind of questions the company asks, where to find the resources.
Learn to invest your time efficiently.
If you're in ECE 2nd year and decided to choose Hardware, then I'd suggest developing a good understanding of EDC, DSD, NA, SS, Control Systems in the curriculum itself. Trust me it'll save a lot of time and help a lot in the long run. You can use this time to practice a lot of questions.
Keep an eye on the Apprenticeship Programs conducted by various Associations and clubs. Also, being in touch with seniors gives an advantage.
Also don't just bluntly ignore coding unless you're very sure to go HARD :)
Solve General Aptitude and Verbal Reasoning questions on the IndiaBix website.
Solve puzzles for technical interviews from GeeksForGeeks.
HirePro data interpretation questions and answers.
Practice MCQs on C programming & Data Structures from IndiaBIX and GeeksForGeeks.
Morris Mano for theory. Solve all the questions at the end of each chapter.
Checkout Digital Electronics Crash Course on Kreatryx YT channel by Shankar Sir.
Solve all the MCQs on Digital Electronics from IndiaBIX and from GATE PYQs
You can also try Special Problems on Sequential Circuits from Unacademy.
For Verilog, you should refer to the book Samir Palnitkar & Verilogmaster blog.
Solve questions from IndiaBIX on other subjects like Electronic Devices and Circuits, network analysis, Signals and Systems etc..
Vlsiexpert blog is the one-stop solution for Static Timing Analysis.
Interview and HR
There are some good videos for interviews on YT. Many other company specific resources are available on the web.
Additional info for our viewers:
"Early Bird Catches The Worm". And it is never too late to start. I started my preparation from zero just after 2-2 from BLE, NA! :)
Practice a lot of questions from various resources available online, you're just a search away! Surf online and get to know the type of questions asked. Extract every piece of useful information available on the web.
Form a small team of like-minded people, it'll help a lot. Share your progress, clear your doubts. Make group projects.
It is OKAY if you lose motivation every 3rd day but remember that Consistency is the key. Take breaks when needed but come back stronger.
Avoid rewarding yourself for completing a task. You have a war to win. Take breaks but do not rest. You can have all the fun after you make it for real.
In short, I'd say go GHOST MODE!

Description of Technical Interview:
Round 1(45 min, Online)
Q. He took my intro, and asked some opps questions.
Q. You have an array, which has 2 types of flower (type 1 is represented as 0 and cost p coins, and type 2 is represented as 1 and cost q coins). You have to make bouquet which
1. must contain k flowers (continuous in given array)
2. must have both types of flower.
3. and have to minimize the cost.
I told him my logic, and wrote the code. He just looked at my code, and asked me if I had some for him.
At the end he wished best of luck for the next Round🙂.
Round 2(45 min, Offline)
Q. He took my intro and asked some opps questions.

Electrical and Electronics Engineering
Texas Instruments is a global semiconductor design and manufacturing company that produces a wide range of products, including microcontrollers, analog integrated circuits, and embedded processors.
An Analog Design Engineer at Texas Instruments is responsible for designing and developing analog integrated circuits for a variety of applications. This includes designing and testing circuits, analyzing data, and troubleshooting any issues that arise. The engineer must also be able to work with other teams to ensure that the design meets the customer’s needs.
CGPA Cutoff 6, NO ACTIVE BACKLOGS
There are 2 rounds
Round 1 - OT
Round 2 - Technical interview
Description of Online test:
Basically, there are 4 sections in the online test. aptitude section is compulsory for everyone; the remaining 3 sections are analog, digital, and embedded software. We can choose any sections we want. The above 3 sections are not compulsory for everyone so I choose both analog and digital sections. Questions asked in the analog section are pretty tricky and also some questions are lengthy. the analog section covers topics like OPAMPs, Rc-Circuits(very important), MOSFETs, BJTs, and Diode circuits .one should practice a lot of questions from the above topics I prefer sedra smith and gate questions for practice and also listen to Razavi lectures(electronics-1 playlist)  in youtube. those lectures are very well explained by Razavi himself (these lectures are very important for a basic understanding of analog electronics; he is a masterpiece If I can say in one word).
In the Digital section questions are asked from topics like counters,8086 microcontroller, pipeline registers, setup time, Hold Time, Verilog, and FSM. etc questions are pretty easy basic concepts are required.I prefer Bhima Shankar sir lectures from the Kreatryx channel(
https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLs5_Rtf2P2r77kmBnXAe06RsI3VadeQ5s
Follow this playlist ) and practice previous year gate questions.
Description of Technical Interview:
I was selected for both analog and digital Roles
For Analog Role The interview started with a self-introduction. there are two  interviewers  for me they are very friendly so don't need to panic after that one of the interviewers posed a question about the Rc circuit and asked about output voltage it is an easy question but tricky they give lots of time to think so don't panic keep calm and think correctly and asked a couple of questions from Rc circuits they are very easy (do lots of Questions  from Rc circuits I prefer Nagendra Krishnapura  lectures and follow this blog
http://coreplacementsnsit.blogspot.com/2018/08/hi-i-am-rachit_14.html?m=1)
and then after they moved onto diode circuits asked output  voltage of peak detector circuit and clipper circuits they are easy questions as I practiced a lot of questions on Diode circuits from sedra smith  and they asked  basic questions on oscillators (OPAMP) the overall duration of the interview is 50 minutes lastly I will say one important thing in the interview try question even if you don't know the answer they will see your approach not the final answer so approach is very important not answer.
Description of HR Round:
2-3 months of rigorous practice and revision is enough to crack the internship. consistency and revision are two important factors. I started my preparation during the summer vacation, before that I was weak in analog electronics. I didn't even know some basic concepts. I prefer Razavi's lectures and Razavi's book for concept-building and practice purposes. if you have enough time do problems from sedra smith
Razavi lectures(electronics-1 playlist is enough for internship )
sedra smith (for diode circuits and OPAMPs)
Ak Chakraborty for basic  circuit theory
Nagendra krishnapura  lectures(Especially For OPAMP and RC circuits )
Follow this blog its very useful
http://coreplacementsnsit.blogspot.com/2018/08/hi-i-am-rachit_14.html?m=1

Electronics and Communication Engineering
Round 1-OT
Round 2- Technical interview (technical rounds varied for each student, but for many, it was one)
Description of Online test:
I selected a digital electronics stream.The test included questions from the number system, counters,8086 microcontroller,pipeline registers,Verilog,FSM. etc. But the way of asking questions was so subtle that you have to spare a minute just to understand the question.
Description of Technical Interview:
The interview started with a self introduction, where I included my interests part(vlsi). He started questioning from that domain. Most of them are from Verilog language. You need to have a clear understanding of all operators and loops, blocking and non blocking assignment, flow of compilation of programs. Questions were a bit tacky but the interviewer tries to help you with some clues which you must be able to catch on time. After 1 hr on Verilog ,He moved to digital electronics and some OT questions where you have to justify your answer. It lasted for nearly 3 hours.
Description of HR Round:
All you need is 2-3 months for complete preparation. Have a clear understanding of concepts and get all your doubts cleared before the exam. Try to have deep knowledge in one or two areas and just move the interviewer's eye on these topics by relating every question into them. Then you can pull it off easily if you are calm and confident. The interviewer will be ready to help you if you get stuck somewhere, all you need to do is analyze the question as much as you can until you untie it. Be confident about what you have answered and try to have a two way communication rather than like a question-answer session.
1. Morris mano for digital electronics
2. Try to look into the exercises part too.You can get solutions from YouTube with explanation.Just listen at 2X.
3. A language. For Verilog go for Samir paltnekar and for practice hdl.bits would be helpful.
4. Free quiz at vlsielearn website.(for better understanding of concepts)
Additional info for our viewers:
Be confident. If you are trying for something, try to have a clear understanding of that area. For eg: If you are interested in digital electronics intern,Try to gather some info about its importance in different domains (vlsi, embedded systems etc).This gives you an insight of what the interviewer expects from your side and what skills you need to develop for better growth.

Description of Online test:
Online coding and Aptitude round
We have different sections with time limits for each section and we cannot go back to previous questions in the aptitude and English section. Questions of aptitude and english were easy and can be solved without prior practice.
The time limit for the coding section was 30 min and contained 2 medium level questions.
Description of Technical Interview:
Technical Interview 1 :
The interviewer was very kind and polite and I was feeling very comfortable with him.
At first, he told me to introduce myself. After that he started to ask me questions on different data structures such as Dijakarta, knapsack,linked list, shortest path algorithm and then he asked basic questions on oops. As I have a project on dbms then he asked to explain it and also asked cross sections such as what joins, rdbms,normalization,constraint,relationship etc. In the end he asked me to write the code for dividing a circular linked list in two halves.
Technical Interview 2:
It was a short round of 1/2 hrs. It was basically a managerial cum technical round. He asked me about my branch and my jee score. His focus was also on your communication as well as presentation skill. Then he asked me basic question on dsa and finally asked to code a question on my favorite data structure
Description of HR Round:
It was not an elimination round for us. It was a telephonic round and she asked me my name and my interview experience and any doubts about the internship.
First and foremost make a good command on dsa. Try to solve as many questions as you can. For beginner level you can practice on hackerrank and then move to leetcode/gfg.I will prefer leetcode over gfg. Trees, linked lists, and stack are the most important data structures. You can also do some competitive programming from codeforces. It will give you an edge in ots .
And finally give equal weightage to oops and dbms. Interviewers ask many questions from their topics.
For dbms, gate smasher YouTube Channel
